title: ISIS May Be At Peak Strength, With 'Easiest Dominoes' Fallen
teaser: Robert Siegel speaks with Ramzy Mardini, who argues that overstating the threat from ISIS could lead the U.S. to another tragic foreign policy mistake.
contentencoded:
Robert Siegel speaks with Ramzy Mardini, a fellow at the Atlantic Council, about his recent opinion piece "The Islamic State Threat Is Overstated" in The Washington Post, in which he argues that overstating the threat from ISIS could lead the U.S. to another tragic foreign policy mistake.

Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
